node.text:
⁣
Follow the real-life journey of 6⃣ people from 🇮🇳 🇯🇴 🇨🇳⁣🇬🇪⁣🇺🇾⁣🇿🇦⁣ as they try to quit tobacco for good.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
In the last episode of the Quitter Diaries, check back in with our quitters for one last time to see how quitting tobacco has changed their lives.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣Quitters are winners 🎉 - #CommitToQuit tobacco today for a healthier life!

node.text:
⁣
▶️ Are you planning to #QuitTobacco during the pandemic?⁣
▶️ What risk does #COVID19 pose to a tobacco user?⁣
⁣
Learn how the tobacco industry lured people to consume tobacco during the pandemic. Dr Hebe Gouda explains the health benefits of quitting tobacco in #Sciencein5.

node.text:
If you are fully vaccinated, can you still get #COVID19? Dr Kate O'Brien explains in #ScienceIn5 

Whether you're vaccinated or still waiting, keep following these precautions to protect yourself and others:
❌ Avoid crowds
↔️ Keep physical distance
😷 Wear a mask
🪟 Open windows
👐 Clean your hands

node.text:
If you have recovered from #COVID19 but are still experiencing certain symptoms you could have post COVID-19 condition or "long COVID". What are these symptoms? How long do they last and are there any treatment options? 
Find out in the latest #ScienceIn5 episode.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Health Organization on September 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization Blood clots and COVID-19 vaccines A new form of blood clotting has been reported in very rare instances after vaccination with AstraZeneca and Janssen COVID-19 vaccines. Did you know? The risk of blood clot from COVID-19 disease much higher than from COVID-19 vaccines. The risk of serious side effects after vaccination with AstraZeneca or the Janssen vaccine is very small. Get vaccinated, as soon as it is your turn. 03/09/2021'.

node.text: Blood clots after receiving a #COVID19 AstraZeneca or the Janssen vaccine are rare. Get vaccinated, as soon as it’s your turn.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Health Organization on September 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization Blood clots and COVID-19 vaccines A new form of blood clotting has been reported in very rare instances after vaccination with AstraZeneca and Janssen COVID-19 vaccines. Did you know? The risk of blood clot from COVID-19 disease much higher than from COVID-19 vaccines. The risk of serious side effects after vaccination with AstraZeneca or the Janssen vaccine is very small. Get vaccinated, as soon as it is your turn. 03/09/2021'.

Photo by World Health Organization on September 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization Blood clots and GOVID-19 vaccines The symptoms of very rare cases of blood clotting after vaccination with AstraZeneca and Janssen COVID-1 vaccines are: severe headache or blurred vision chest or abdominal pain vomiting leg swelling or unusual skin bruising difficulty breathing Contact your doctor immediately if you have any of these symptoms within 30 days of vaccination. The risk of serious side effects after vaccination with AstraZeneca or the Janssen vaccine is very small. Get vaccinated, as soon as it 03/09/2021 your turn.'.

node.text:
⁣
Follow the real-life journey of 6⃣ people from 🇮🇳 🇯🇴 🇨🇳⁣🇬🇪⁣🇺🇾⁣🇿🇦⁣ as they try to quit tobacco for good.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
In the last episode of the Quitter Diaries, check back in with our quitters for one last time to see how quitting tobacco has changed their lives.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣Quitters are winners 🎉 - #CommitToQuit tobacco today for a healthier life!

▶️ Are you planning to #QuitTobacco during the pandemic?⁣
▶️ What risk does #COVID19 pose to a tobacco user?⁣
⁣
Learn how the tobacco industry lured people to consume tobacco during the pandemic. Dr Hebe Gouda explains the health benefits of quitting tobacco in #Sciencein5.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Health Organization on September 04, 2021. May be an image of one or more people.

node.text:
Our logistics hub at the International Humanitarian City in Dubai, #UAE 🇦🇪, helps WHO respond to health emergencies around the world, from natural disasters to disease outbreaks. ⁣
⁣
Since the start of the #COVID19 pandemic, the Dubai hub has completed 700+ air shipments ✈️ to 120+ countries around the 🌏🌍🌎.⁣
⁣
Every week, the team manages the physical movement of 100+ metric tons of material. They dispatch about USD 700,000 in health supplies every 5⃣ days.⁣
⁣
This week critical medical supplies will be dispatched to Afghanistan, Ethiopia, Iran, Nigeria, and Yemen.⁣
⁣
Photos ©️ WHO / Natalie Naccache

node.text:
Why should we care about #dementia❓ ⁣
⁣
Dementia is an illness characterized by a deterioration in cognitive function beyond what might be expected from normal ageing.⁣
⁣
It is a major cause of disability and dependency among older people 👵👴.⁣
⁣
Dementia is currently the 7⃣th leading cause of death, affecting more than 5⃣5⃣ million people worldwide.

node.text:
Pandemics like #COVID19 highlight the need for a global response based on strengthened epidemic intelligence.

Today, @drtedros and @bundeskanzlerin Merkel inaugurated a new WHO Hub for pandemic and epidemic intelligence.

The 🆕 Hub will generate:
✅ better data
✅ better analytics
✅ better decisions
across all aspects of managing public health emergencies.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization OPIOID DEPENDENCE IS A GROWING PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUE'.

node.text:
It's International Overdose Awareness Day!⁣
 ⁣
#Opioid dependence is not a self-acquired bad habit but a complex #MentalHealth condition.⁣
⁣
Over 100000 people die from opioid overdoses every year. There are effective treatment interventions for opioid dependence that can reduce the risk of overdose, yet less than 10% of people in need are receiving it.⁣
⁣
Swipe 👉 to learn more about opioid dependence including risk factors and signs of opioid overdose!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization OPIOID DEPENDENCE IS A GROWING PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUE'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization UNDERSTANDING OPIOID DEPENDENCE The term 'opioids' includes compounds that are extracted from the poppy seed and also prescription opioids used for the treatment of pain. Opioid dependence is a disorder of regulation of opioid use arising from their repeated or continuous use.'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization PREVALENCE OF OPIOID OVERDOSE 100 000 Over 100 000 people die from opioid overdose every year #1 Overdose is the leading cause ofavoidable death among people who inject drugs 10% Less than 10% ofpeople need .h treatmentfor opioid dependence receive it.'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization RISK FACTORS FOR OPIOID OVERDOSE 1. medical supervision Using opioids without 2. opioids use High dosages of 3 use after Resumption of opioid extended period fabnnce → 4. injection Taking opioids by 5 .medical conditions Concurrent 6. with some other substances Using opioids in combination ormedicines'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization SIGNS OF OPIOID OVERDOSE 1. 2. 3. Pinpoint pupils 4. Unconsciousness 5. Shallow/slow Breathing 6 Pale skin Blue lips Snoring/rasping breath'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'World Health Organization TIPS FOR FIRST RESPONDERS The medication naloxone can prevent death from an opioid overdose administeredin time Naloxone effective when delivered intravenous, intramuscular, subcutaneous and intranasal routes of administration People using Naloxone should select route of administration based formulation available, their skills in administration, the setting and local context In suspected opioid overdose, first responders should focus on airway management, assisting ventilation and administering naloxone After successful resuscitation following the administration of naloxone, level consciousness and breathing the affected person should be closely observed until they have fully recovered'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'OPIOID DEPENDENCE IS NOT A SELF-ACQUIRED BAD HABIT BUT A COMPLEX MENTAL HEALTH ISSUE World Health Organization'.

Photo by World Health Organization on August 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'COVID-19 Vaccines World Health Organization Getting vaccinated against COVID-19 helps protect you from getting sick. Why? Vaccination reduces your risk of getting seriously ill and dying from COVID-19. The vaccine can create mild side effects such as headache, fever & body aches, but these normally go away within a couple days. Serious side effects are very should be reported to your healthcare provider. and'.

node.text: Getting vaccinated 💉 against #COVID19 helps protect you from getting sick.

node.text:
In addition to supporting 🇭🇹#Haiti’s Ministry of Health and Population and emergency medical teams on the ground, WHO has delivered medical supplies and sent experts to help reestablish health services after the recent earthquake. ⁣
⁣
Photos: PAHO/WHO
